meanings.definition: To convert (an atom, molecule, or substance) into an ion.
meanings.sent1: The experiment showed how heating the gas was ionising it.
meanings.sent2: The radiation was ionising the particles in the chamber.
meanings.sent3: The mad scientist's machine was ionising everything in sight!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to ionise the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm's energy felt like ionising electricity in the air.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing ions, especially by removing electrons from atoms.
meanings.sent1: The ionising radiation affected the nearby materials.
meanings.sent2: The sun's rays have ionising properties that can be harmful.
meanings.sent3: The ionising superhero could control the ions around him.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an ionising effect on everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The ionising power of the machine was truly remarkable.
